name: Rubicon 1986
description: ‘In an increasingly crowded field of local excellence, this remains among the top South African claret blends; consistently elegant (where others sometimes score with overpowering force), medium-bodied, carefully oaked, restrained but perfumed, with some classic, minerally, claret undertones. There’s a pleasing consistency of style from the beginning in which Giorgio Dalla Cia takes justifiable pride. ‘86 will outclass them all, very tight at present, but should open dramatically; concentrated cedary/vanilla notes flow from bouquet onto palate of ample blackcurrant fruit with tough tannic reserves aboard for longevity. A blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc. Hannes Myburgh and Dalla Cia have joined the contemporary race and stepped up the new oak maturation.’ - Platter’s SA Wine Guide 1990, 4.5☆ The wines will continue to be cellared at the Meerlust vintage cellar until maturity (estimated 2028) or withdrawal. Rubicon is not produced every year. If a vintage is not produced, the NFT will include the next vintage, to total 50 consecutive vintages
